b522b9f9-8da3-43d5-b6bd-45f6e289403e.plaintext: Plone 6 allows editors to build sophisticated multi-column page layouts with the Grid Block.

children.text: Plone 6 allows editors to build sophisticated multi-column page layouts with the Grid Block.

columns.description: The simulation of complex systems in natural science or engineering depends on the development of adequate mathematical models. Thus the development of realistic and yet efficient models is one of our core activities.

href.Description: The simulation of complex systems in natural science or engineering depends on the development of adequate mathematical models. Thus the development of realistic and yet efficient models is one of our core activities.
href.Title: Modelling and Simulation
href.title: Modelling and Simulation

columns.title: Modelling and Simulation

columns.description: There is a broad class of algorithms and methods that are common to several scientific or engineering problems. Ideally, the development of simulation programs follows a layered design in which generic methods are applied to create or extend domain-specific solutions.

href.Description: Efficient simulations need powerful algorithms and methods.
href.Title: Algorithms and Methods
href.title: Algorithms and Methods

columns.title: Algorithms and Methods

columns.description: Through research on resource and data management, workflows, virtualisation, and security we foster the easy and secure access to distributed systems and data that builds the foundation for the exploitation of results across scientific domains.

href.Description: Through research on resource and data management, workflows, virtualisation, and security we foster the easy and secure access to distributed systems and data that builds the foundation for the exploitation of results across scientific domains.
href.Title: Distributed Computing
href.title: Distributed Computing

columns.title: Distributed Computing And Parallel Computing

columns.description: In the human disease retinitis pigmentosa the photoreceptors degenerate, leading to blindness. Electrical prostheses can elicit visual sensations in patients; however, processes secondary to photoreceptor death lead to pathological rhythmic activity in the remaining retinal network that seems to interfere with this therapeutic approach.

href.Description: In the human disease retinitis pigmentosa the photoreceptors degenerate, leading to blindness. Electrical prostheses can elicit visual sensations in patients; however, processes secondary to photoreceptor death lead to pathological rhythmic activity in the remaining retinal network that seems to interfere with this therapeutic approach.
href.Title: Novel therapeutic options for human diseases
href.title: Novel therapeutic options for human diseases

columns.title: Novel Therapeutic Options for Human Diseases

columns.description: Monogenetic diseases provide a direct link between a change in protein function to cell and organ dysfunction. Studying monogenetic diseases often permits identification of cellular roles of ion channels. Moreover, disease-causing mutations usually affect important functions of the affected proteins, and analysis of the functional consequences.

href.Description: Monogenetic diseases provide a direct link between a change in protein function to cell and organ dysfunction. Studying monogenetic diseases often permits identification of cellular roles of ion channels. Moreover, disease-causing mutations usually affect important functions of the affected proteins, and analysis of the functional consequences of such mutations thus provides novel insights into the molecular determinants of protein functions.
href.Title: Pathomechanisms of human diseases
href.title: Pathomechanisms of human diseases

columns.title: Generation, Propagation and Transmission of Cellular Signals

columns.description: Information processing in the central nervous system relies on the precise interplay of electrical and chemical signals. Action potential generation, propagation, and the initiating events causing transmitter release from the synaptic terminus are determined by the activity of a variety of ion channels. The transfer of information between neurons and target cells is achieved by chemical transmitter substances crossing the synaptic cleft. Neurotransmitter are accumulated in presynaptic vesicles whose fusion with the cell membrane results in neurotransmitter release.

href.Description: Information processing in the central nervous system relies on the precise interplay of electrical and chemical signals. Action potential generation, propagation, and the initiating events causing transmitter release from the synaptic terminus are determined by the activity of a variety of ion channels. The transfer of information between neurons and target cells is achieved by chemical transmitter substances crossing the synaptic cleft. Neurotransmitter are accumulated in presynaptic vesicles whose fusion with the cell membrane results in neurotransmitter release.
